title: 'Don't want to fight but ...': China blasts US over extra 100% tariff; calls out 'double standards'
content: The trade war between the United States and China has intensified. Washington imposed a 100% tariff on Chinese goods. Beijing accused the US of double standards and warned of consequences. China also introduced new controls on rare earth exports. These actions have severely damaged trade relations and prospects for dialogue between the two nations.

title: 'Retaliation for air strikes': Clashes break out between Pak army & Taliban along border
content: “In retaliation for the air strikes by Pakistani forces,” Taliban border forces in the east “engaged in heavy clashes against Pakistani forces’ posts in various border areas,” the Afghan military said in a statement, quoted by AFP. On Thursday, two explosions were heard in the Afghan capital and another in the southeast of the country.

title: Durgapur gang-rape case: Student's father raises suspicion over male friend’s role
content: A second-year medical student in Durgapur was allegedly gang-raped by four-five unknown men outside her campus after going out for dinner with a male classmate. The classmate has been detained by police as the girl's parents suspect his involvement. The survivor is hospitalized and an investigation is underway.

title: 'Dekho Starc saamne khada hai': Fans give Rohit Sharma bizarre motivation - watch
content: Former India captain Rohit Sharma honed his skills at Mumbai's Shivaji Park for nearly two hours, practicing against pace and spin. Fans urged him to lead India to the 2027 World Cup victory, highlighting his crucial role. Sharma is set to return to international cricket for the upcoming ODI series against Australia. A bizarre motivation call for the batter left fans in splits.

title: 'China using these gadgets to spy on Americans', says FCC; issues security notice
content: The FCC has issued a national security notice, warning that Chinese electronics pose a surveillance and security threat to Americans. Millions of prohibited product listings, including security cameras and smartwatches from companies like Huawei and Hikvision, have been removed from US retail platforms. This action is part of Washington's ongoing crackdown on Chinese technology firms due to national security concerns.

title: Watch: Trump’s granddaughter asks him, 'Is there a dream you’re chasing?'
content: During a golf outing, President Trump was asked by his granddaughter, Kai, if he still had dreams to chase. Trump humorously compared her questions to a TV interview before stating that becoming president was the dream, and now he dreams of being a great one.

title: IND vs WI: Granddaddy hundreds! Gavaskar urges Jaiswal to keep scoring big
content: Yashasvi Jaiswal's brilliant 175 against West Indies at Delhi showcased his class, though a mix-up ended his innings prematurely. This fifth 150+ score before 24 places him with Graeme Smith.  Legend Sunil Gavaskar humorously urged him to score 'granddaddy hundreds,' highlighting Jaiswal's burgeoning potential and consistency.

title: 'Indians' success in US no conspiracy': Zoho's Sridhar Vembu
content: Zoho CEO Sridhar Vembu explains why Indian professionals dominate American technology leadership, attributing it to unintended consequences of the H-1B visa and green card system. The lengthy immigration process made job switching risky, creating committed long-term employees who naturally earned promotions. Vembu emphasises R&D success requires time-intensive commitment, not just funding. His comments come amid controversy over Trump's proposed $100,000 H-1B fee.

title: 'I'll dismiss him in 3–6 balls': Pakistan fast bowler's challenge to Abhishek Sharma
content: Pakistan pacer Ihsanullah has boldly challenged India's star batter Abhishek Sharma, claiming he can dismiss him within six balls. Ihsanullah, known for his express pace, believes his bowling will trouble the in-form left-hander. Sharma, meanwhile, continues his meteoric rise, impressing legends like Brian Lara with his explosive batting.

title: US school campus shooting: At least 4 dead, 12 injured in Mississippi
content: Tragedy struck Leland, Mississippi, early Saturday as a shooting during homecoming weekend claimed four lives and injured at least twelve. Crowds gathered on the main street for the high school festivities when the violence erupted. Authorities are actively investigating the incident, with the Mississippi Bureau of Investigation assisting local efforts.

title: 'Removed brain with spoon': NYC teen beheads mom’s BF; mother blames system
content: A shocking incident unfolded in Staten Island where a mother recounted her son's alleged brutal killing of her boyfriend. The young man, reportedly battling mental illness, is accused of a horrific act. His mother believes his medical care was mishandled, leading to this tragedy. Authorities are investigating the disturbing details of the crime scene.

title: Dallas Cowboys cheerleader sparks debate with shocking pom-pom rule
content: Dallas Cowboys Cheerleader Abby Summers' viral TikTok revealed the laborious process of preparing pom-poms, sparking fan outrage. Viewers criticized the multi-billion dollar organization for expecting cheerleaders to perform such tasks themselves, drawing parallels to football players receiving equipment support. The discussion highlights the often-unseen labor behind the iconic cheer squad.

title: Microsoft engineer quits after 13 years; sends resignation email to employees
content: A senior Microsoft engineer has resigned protesting the company's cloud contracts with the Israeli military. Scott Sutfin-Glowski cited enabling potential atrocities as his reason for leaving. This follows months of internal dissent and employee firings over Gaza-related demonstrations. Microsoft previously stopped some services to an Israeli intelligence unit after a report. However, many contracts remain active, and employee protests continue. Activists demand a complete cut of ties with Israel.

title: Ayesha Curry’s marriage confession sparks backlash as NFL star Cam Newton steps in
content: NBA star Stephen Curry's wife, Ayesha, faced fan backlash for her candid remarks about not initially wanting marriage or children. Despite criticism, she received support from figures like Cam Newton, who praised her honesty.  Others, including Gilbert Arenas and Stephen himself, have rallied behind her, highlighting the misunderstanding of her sentiments.

title: Jaz Elle’s one-word reply melts hearts on Agassi’s iconic style
content: Tennis icon Andre Agassi, fresh off leading Team World to victory at the 2025 Laver Cup, delighted fans with a throwback post of his iconic 80s and 90s fashion. His daughter, Jaz Elle Agassi, praised his "Majestic" style. Agassi also shared his competitive spirit as captain, calling the win a "special week."

title: 'She’s really scared': Taylor Swift’s behavior leaves Blake Lively worried about future
content: Blake Lively is reportedly anxious about her career following a supposed rift with close friend Taylor Swift. Sources suggest Lively fears Swift's significant influence in Hollywood could impact her professional future. Despite attempts to reconcile, Lively is said to be struggling with the silence from Swift, who has yet to address the alleged fallout publicly.

title: Cam Newton’s kids: Meet his children and 3 mothers behind his life beyond football
content: Former NFL quarterback Cam Newton has welcomed his ninth child, a son with girlfriend Jasmin Brown. Newton, who also has two children with Brown and four with ex-girlfriend Kia Proctor, emphasizes love and accountability in his large family. Despite post-NFL challenges, his children remain his greatest source of strength and purpose.

title: Newest sensation! Meet Harjas Singh: Son of bus drivers who has taken Australia by storm
content: Harjas Singh, the 20-year-old son of Indian-origin bus drivers in Australia, smashed 35 sixes in a record-breaking 314* off 141 balls, rewriting a 120-year-old record. His explosive innings made him the newest sensation in Australian cricket.

title: Assam SIT awaits Singapore nod to Zubeen death evidence access
content: Assam Police's SIT awaits crucial evidence from Singapore regarding Zubeen Garg's drowning, invoking a Mutual Legal Assistance Treaty. Investigations are hampered by international legal complexities, with authorities emphasizing adherence to treaties. Meanwhile, the viscera report is under examination, and public demand for justice intensifies.

title: How much do cricket commentators earn? Staggering numbers revealed
content: Cricket commentators' earnings vary significantly, with freshers earning around Rs 35,000-40,000 daily, potentially reaching Rs 2-2.5 lakh monthly. Top-tier commentators, however, can command Rs 6-10 lakh per day, leading to annual incomes of Rs 10-12 crore.  These lucrative figures reflect the profession's evolution into a competitive field demanding expertise and entertainment.

title: PM meets Qualcomm CEO, says India offers unmatched talent
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi said India offers unmatched talent and scale to build technologies that will shape the world's collective future. His remarks came after a meeting with Cristiano R. Amon, President and CEO of Qualcomm, highlighting India's growing role in semiconductor and artificial intelligence (AI) innovation.

title: 72-yr-old man poisons wife, ends life on Karva Chauth
content: A 72-year-old man allegedly poisoned his 70-year-old wife and then himself on Karva Chauth in Uttar Pradesh. The couple, suffering from illness and marital discord, consumed poison at Ramghat. Both succumbed to the toxic substance, with the woman dying en route to the hospital.

title: COBRA commando injured in Maoist-triggered IED blast in Chhattisgarh
content: A Cobra commando sustained minor injuries in an IED blast triggered by Maoists in Chhattisgarh's Bijapur district. The incident occurred during a routine patrol near a Forward Operating Base in the Pujari Kanker area. Security forces have launched a search operation and intensified patrols to prevent further attacks.

title: US hits China with 100% tariffs! Will it benefit India? Here’s what experts say
content: Indian exporters are poised to benefit from increased US tariffs on Chinese goods, potentially shifting demand towards India. Experts believe this escalation, with the US imposing a 100% additional tariff on Chinese imports, will create a level playing field and open significant export opportunities for India in the American market.

title: Patrick and Brittany Mahomes’ kids: Inside the happy life of Sterling, Bronze, and Golden
content: NFL star Patrick Mahomes and wife Brittany are cherishing moments with their three children: Sterling, Bronze, and Golden. Despite the spotlight, they prioritize a normal family life, often sharing glimpses of their joy.  Golden's birth during the playoffs highlighted their commitment to balancing football and family, showcasing a loving and grounded household.

title: Triple murder: UP cleric’s wife, 2 daughters found dead inside Meerut mosque complex
content: A cleric's wife and two young daughters were brutally murdered with a blunt object inside a mosque complex in Baghpat's Gangnauli village. Their bodies were discovered by children arriving for evening tuition. Police are investigating all angles, including family disputes and robbery, to apprehend the perpetrator.

title: Takeaways, best moments from Brewers' NLDS Game 5 win over Cubs
content: With a win against their division rivals, the Brewers move on to a date with the Dodgers in the NLCS.

title: Brewers top Cubs to make first NLCS since 2018
content: The Brewers won their first playoff series since 2018 after defeating rival Chicago 3-1 in the decisive Game 5 of their NL Division Series on Saturday.

title: 'Not just one-hit wonder': Indiana upsets Oregon
content: Indiana remained undefeated with a 30-20 win over No. 3 Oregon. The win snapped a record streak of losses to AP top-five opponents.

title: Allar injured, out for year as PSU's skid hits 3
content: Penn State quarterback Drew Allar, who left the Nittany Lions' stunning 22-21 loss to Northwestern on Saturday, is out for the season, coach James Franklin said in his postgame media availability, not long after his reeling team fell to 3-3.

content: Arizona Cardinals QB Kyler Murray is expected to miss Sunday's game against the Colts due to a foot injury. Jacoby Brissett is slated to start.

content: Arch Manning was 21-of-27 passing for 166 yards, and Texas got a much-needed 23-6 win over sixth-ranked Oklahoma.

title: Gaza Ceasefire Continues But Many Unresolved Questions Remain
content: A ceasefire was holding in Gaza between Israel and Hamas on Saturday after two years of war. But will the agreement lead, as US President Donald Trump proclaimed, to "a Strong, Durable, and Everlasting Peace"?

title: Pakistan Summons Afghan Envoy Over Joint Statement During India Visit
content: Pakistan on Saturday summoned the Afghan ambassador to convey its "strong reservations" over the India-Afghanistan joint statement issued in New Delhi a day earlier.

title: CCTV Captures Man Stealing Rs 40 Lakh 'Kalash' From Jain Temple In Delhi
content: A gold-plated 'kalash' worth around Rs 40 lakh was allegedly stolen from the spire of a Jain temple in northeast Delhi's Jyoti Nagar, police said on Saturday.

title: Heavy Clashes Along Pak-Afghan Border, Then A Taliban Warning
content: Afghanistan's Taliban forces launched armed reprisals against Pakistani soldiers along the shared border on Saturday, accusing Islamabad of carrying out air strikes on its soil.

title: Court Orders Google To Remove Objectionable Videos Against Spiritual Leader
content: The Lucknow Bench of the Allahabad High Court on Saturday directed Meta and Google to remove within 48 hours allegedly objectionable videos circulating on social media against Ramkatha narrator and Padma Vibhushan awardee Jagadguru Rambhadracharya

title: Nobel Winners Abhijit Banerjee, Esther Duflo To Leave US Amid Funding Row
content: US-based Nobel laureates Esther Duflo and Abhijit Banerjee will soon join the University of Zurich, where they will establish a new centre for development economics, the institution said Friday.

title: Centre Pushes 'Swadeshi Tech' With Made-In-India Navigation App 'Mappls'
content: Union Minister Ashwini Vaishnaw on Saturday experienced 'Mappls' - a completely Made-in-India smart navigation app developed by MapmyIndia.

title: Minor Dalit Student Gang Raped In Lucknow, Suspects Still At Large
content: A 16-year-old Class 11 student was allegedly raped by five unidentified men in Lucknow on Saturday, a police officer said.

title: "Girls Must Thrive, Not Just Survive": Top Court Judge On Worsening Sex Ratios
content: Supreme Court judge BV Nagarathna on Saturday expressed concern about the deteriorating sex ratios due to potential female infanticide and foeticide in certain states, stating that girls should not merely survive but thrive.

title: India, Canada Trade Ministers Discuss Ways To Strengthen Economic Ties
content: Commerce and Industry Minister Piyush Goyal on Saturday held discussions with his Canadian counterpart Maninder Sidhu on ways to strengthen economic ties between the two countries.

title: "Yet To Hear From Singapore Officials": Police On Zubeen Garg Death Probe
content: Assam Police were yet to hear from Singaporean authorities on their request for information regarding cultural icon Zubeen Garg's death in the Southeast Asian nation while swimming in the sea last month, a senior officer said here on Saturday.

title: IndiGo To Start Direct Flights From Delhi To China, Vietnam From November 10
content: Expanding its international network, IndiGo will start flights from the national capital to Guangzhou in China and Hanoi in Vietnam from November 10.

title: Bihar Man Wanted To Marry Girlfriend, So He Set Second Wife Ablaze
content: A man in Bihar wanted to marry his girlfriend, but his second wife objected. Angered by this, he doused her in petrol, released LPG, and set her ablaze, officials said on Saturday.

title: Class 9 Student Dies During Sports Event In Private School In Kolkata
content: A class 9 student of a private international school in the southern fringes of the city died during a sports event on the school ground, a police officer said on Saturday.

title: Bihar's Migrant Workers In Tamil Nadu Unlikely To Travel Home To Vote
content: Travelling over 2,000 km from Tamil Nadu to exercise their franchise during the two-phase elections in early November remains a distant dream for many migrant workers from Bihar, as their insecure jobs make it nearly impossible to take time off.

title: India's Trade With European Countries To Raise $100 Billion In Investments, Create 1 Million Jobs
content: India's trade landscape marked a historic milestone as the India-European Free Trade Association Trade and Economic Partnership Agreement, signed on March 10, 2024, officially came into effect on October 1, 2025.

title: Top Court To Rule On Pleas Seeking Independent Probe Into Karur Stampede
content: The Supreme Court is scheduled to pronounce its order on October 13 on a batch of pleas seeking an independent investigation into the Karur stampede incident in which 41 people lost their lives.

title: Haryana Chief Minister Speaks With Dead Cop's Family, Assures Justice
content: In his first public comments over a case involving an IPS officer's "suicide", Haryana Chief Minister Nayab Singh Saini assured the cop's family members on Saturday that they will get justice.

title: 'Heinous Aggression': Lebanon Slams Overnight Israeli Strike On Civilian Sites
content: Lebanese President Joseph Aoun on Saturday condemned an overnight Israeli strike on civilian sites, which reportedly killed at least one person and which Israel said targeted Hezbollah infrastructure.

title: Many girls still face practices like genital mutilation: CJI
content: a ninejudge SC bench is seized of the challenge to alleged discriminatory practices against women at Sabarimala, Agiyari of Parsi communities and mosques . a national consultation on ‘Safeguarding the girl child: towards a safer and enabling environment for her in India’ is organised by juvenile justice committee headed by Justice B V Nagarathna .

title: As ties thaw, Canada foreign min on two-day India visit
content: anita anand will meet with her counterpart and commerce and industry minister . the visit comes as a boost for efforts by both sides to rebuild the relationship . india is expected to become world's fourth largest economy in 2025 .

title: NDA set to make public Bihar seats pact today
content:
.

NEW DELHI: After days of hectic parleys and hard bargaining by allies, NDA is said to have reached an agreement with its constituents for Bihar polls, and a formal announcement is likely on Sunday. The BJP central election committee (CEC) is set to finalise its candidates at a meeting on Sunday, in the presence of PM Narendra Modi. Senior BJP netas, including HM Amit Shah and party chief J P Nadda, held a meeting with party netas and those of the allies Saturday.

title: Industrial-grade stuff in Coldrif, says SIT, tries to map supply chain
content: the MP SIT probing the coldrif tragedy is examining the entire supply chain of the cough syrup . investigators confirm that Ranganathan Govindan had procured banned industrial-grade diethylene glycol for manufacturing Coldrif . the SIT is now trying to determine how long the chemical had been in use .

title: 2 get life for man’s rape, murder in Agra
content: two men imposed a fine of Rs 50,000 and Rs 25,000 on the two convicts . the case dated back to 2023 when the victim went to attend a birthday party . police said the two accused were also present at the event and took the man out on a motorcycle on the pretext of consuming alcohol .

title: Child marriage and drugs robbing East, NE of vigour: Justice Kant
content: narcotics and psychotropic substances are "hollowing out communities," justice Surya Kant says . the young generation in eastern and north-eastern India is rich in diversity and potential . nalsa executive chairman: "Child marriage continues to robcountless young girls of their childhood"

title: Drug regulator tightens safety norms after cough syrup deaths
content: drugs controller general of India (DCGI) made it mandatory to test for both DEG and ethylene glycol (EG) in all raw materials and finished pharmaceutical products . Earlier, such testing was required only for raw materials, leaving a crucial gap that allowed toxic solvents to enter finished syrups undetected .

title: IndiGo to start Delhi-China direct flights from November 10
content:
Representative image

NEW DELHI: After an over fiveyear lull, India and China will ramp up their direct air connectivity. IndiGo Saturday announced a daily direct flight between Delhi and Guangzhou from Nov 10, shortly after the airline links Kolkata and Guangzhou from October 26. Air India is also set to fly to China before the end of the year and many Chinese carriers will have India flights. IndiGo has been among the first airlines to reinstate flights between the two countries. In 2019, India and China had 539 direct flights operated by airlines including Air India, IndiGo, China Southern and China Eastern. In March 2020, flights were halted during Covid. Since then, travelling between India and China meant doing so through a third country. On October 2, aviation ministry said direct flights “follow continuous technical-level engagement between civil aviation authorities as part of broader efforts to normalise ties.”

End of Article

title: Bumpy road to citizenship
content: The September 1 notification of the Union Ministry of Home Affairs, eliminating the element of criminality on undocumented or overstaying Sri Lankan Tamil refugees, offers hope to those longing for Indian citizenship. Meanwhile, the Tamil Nadu government continues measures to enhance the quality of life of the refugees. T. Ramakrishnan analyses issues and problems faced by the refugees in the State

content: Applicants must still secure trade licences from the District Revenue Officer in the respective districts or from the Commissioner of Police in cities before commencing operations, clarify officials

title: Prime Minister launches ₹130-crore project to modernise fishing harbour in Karaikal
content: The development will include infrastructure such as guard rooms, ramps, repair yards, auction halls, sewage treatment facilities, IoT-based monitoring, satellite communication, and cybersecurity measures

title: Take up rainwater harvesting to ensure long-term water security in villages, says Stalin at gram sabha meeting
content: He advised local body representatives to ensure basic services such as water supply and electricity are not affected during rain and to form committees comprising social groups and local residents to plan in advance for the monsoon

title: Art forms nurtured Tamil language, says Chief Minister M.K. Stalin
content: The Dravidian movement has promoted Tamil music, writing, and theatre; it enriched the language on public platforms and reformed society, says Stalin while conferring Kalaimamani awards; he urges artists from the State to spread Tamil art forms and culture throughout the world

title: Social and Educational Survey: Digital divide leaves senior enumerators struggling
content: While younger enumerators are able to navigate tech issues more easily, senior enumerators lament that they have limited familiarity with digital systems

title: With oral morphine solution inaccessible in districts, hundreds come to Kidwai every month
content: It has been over 10 years since Narcotic Drugs and Psychotropic Substances Act, 1985, was amended in 2014 to streamline the process for medical use of oral morphine and its access to those in need

title: 'Safe haven for rapists': MBBS student gang-raped in West Bengal; BJP attacks CM Mamata Banerjee
content: a second-year MBBS student was allegedly gang-raped by four to five unidentified men . police have detained the student after the survivor's parents alleged he and his associates were involved . the woman is undergoing treatment at hospital .

title: Fugitive Rashid Cablewala, an aide of Hashim Baba, detained in Azerbaijan
content: Raj Shekhar Jha is a journalist for the Times of India with over a decade of experience in reporting on national security, terrorism, crime and prisons.

title: Helicopter crashes in California's Huntington Beach; 5 injured - watch
content: At TOI World Desk, our dedicated team of seasoned journalists and passionate writers tirelessly sifts through the vast tapestry of global events to bring you the latest news and diverse perspectives round the clock. With an unwavering commitment to accuracy, depth, and timeliness, we strive to keep you informed about the ever-evolving world, delivering a nuanced understanding of international affairs to our readers. Join us on a journey across continents as we unravel the stories that shape our interconnected world. Read More

title: U.S. Ambassador-designate Sergio Gor in Delhi, meets PM Modi, Jaishankar, Doval, and Misri
content: U.S. envoy Gor’s visit has raised speculation that he is in New Delhi to firm up details for a meeting between Mr. Trump and Mr. Modi on the sidelines of the upcoming ASEAN-related summits in Kuala Lumpur

title: Police stop Congress leaders from visiting Rae Bareli lynching victim’s family
content: State unit president Ajay Rai and others were stopped right outside the party office; they vow to continue to support Valmiki’s family

title: Unease in Congress State unit over delay in seat sharing for Bihar polls
content: Leaders of the Opposition bloc’s partner Congress say they were getting ‘restive and unnerved’ while pointing out that the party should emerge out of the political shadow of Rashtriya Janata Dal (RJD) in Bihar to contest solo

title: Trinamool claims Tamil Nadu’s new outreach scheme inspired by Bengal initiative
content: Party says Tamil Nadu’s ‘Namma Ooru, Namma Arasu’ modelled on West Bengal’s ‘Amader Para, Amader Samadhan’ participatory governance programme

title: Watch: “BJP is nothing without Nitish Kumar” : Pappu Yadav exclusive
content: Rajesh Ranjan alias Pappu Yadav, is a six-time MP from Bihar who currently represents the constitituency of Purnea, in the State’s border areas, as an Independent MP in the Lok Sabha

title: DKS announces ₹10-crore grant to develop Lalbagh to implement plans suggested by citizens
content: The issues revolve around familiar civic problems such as garbage accumulation, potholes, property clearance delays, inadequate parking, poor infrastructure maintenance, and civic officials’ apathy toward citizens

title: Crime Branch registers a case of “misappropriation” of  Sabarimala temple artefacts
content: The agency names 11 persons, including Unnikrishnan Potti, as suspects. Offences include confidence trickery, cheating, conspiracy, theft and possible violation of the Prevention of Corruption Act

title: Telangana Prisons Department expands legal aid access and digital reform initiatives
content: Department focusing on reform-oriented correctional policies aimed at reformation, rehabilitation and reintegration of inmates

title: Palakkad’s cultural community unite to condemn Israeli ‘aggression’ on Gaza
content: The event featured a variety of performances: sketches telling Palestinian struggles, poetry recitals and plays depicting Gaza’s plight under Israeli conflict.

title: Pawan Singh rules out contesting Bihar Assembly election
content: Bhojpuri actor-singer says he will continue to serve as a ‘soldier’ of the BJP amid speculation over possible candidature

title: Karnataka expanding automated vehicle testing stations to enhance transparency in fitness checks
content: Once these centres become operational, all vehicles seeking renewal of their fitness certificates will be required to undergo testing exclusively at the ATS.

title: True care emerges only from a heart that feels another’s pain: Sara Joseph
content: At World Hospice and Palliative Care Day observance in Thrissur, author Sara Joseph calls for greater empathy and collective reflection on dignified end-of-life care

title: Champions Boat League to begin on Oct. 12
content: The Kerala Tourism-organised Champions Boat League, modelled after the IPL, will take place along the Chaliyar river; Tourism Minister will inaugurate the event, which features 15 boats racing along the course between the old Feroke bridge and the new bridge

title: Munambam HC verdict leads to legal quandary in Kerala
content: Notwithstanding the High Court decision, the Waqf tribunal will have to go ahead with its proceedings in the case, as it is the only jurisdictional forum to decide on the registration of the Waqf and related matters

title: West Bengal records highest number of crimes committed by foreigners: NCRB data
content: This data assumes significance amidst ongoing political developments in the State, with the Opposition in West Bengal alleging a high degree of ‘infiltration’ by Bangladeshi nationals and making that their poll plank for next year’s Assembly election

title: Public irked as Kerala govt.’s citizen portal drops e-application feature
content: Users can no longer submit complaints directly to government departments or generate acknowledgements as proof of submission through the portal

title: Indian, EU officials optimistic about closing trade deal this year
content: Following the 14th round of negotiations in Brussels, officials optimistic about finalising pact; while bilateral trade reached €120 billion in 2014, challenges remain over tariffs, sustainability, and carbon regulations; another round of talks is expected to be held in New Delhi in November

title: How much longer can the Phillies keep contending?
content: the final play of the national league division series against the los Angeles Dodgers will live in your nightmares for a long time . the Phillies were eliminated in Game 4 of the NLDS . there were two other short throws from Game 2 that might have impacted the outcome of the series .

title: All you need to know for every game in Week 6 -- including final score predictions

title: Way-Too-Early WNBA Power Rankings: Early look at 2026
content: the Las Vegas Aces are the 2025 champions after a WNBA Finals sweep over the Phoenix Mercury . this offseason will be the busiest in league history . a new collective bargaining agreement is needed, plus expansion drafts for two new franchises .

title: 'Man, he loves football. You can feel it': How Deebo became an instant hit in D.C.
content: quarterback Jayden Daniels and receiver Deebo Samuel performed their skit in the end zone . Daniels connected with Samuel on a fourth-and-goal from the 8-yard line in the win over the los Angeles Chargers . it's one reason why Samuel is off to such a great start in his first season with Washington .

title: College football Week 7: Indiana pulls huge upset with win over Oregon
content: Week 7  of the college football season features some unlikely undefeated teams out to prove their place among the College Football Playoff contenders. No. 7  Indiana  traveled to face No. 3  Oregon . The Ducks were 7-0 at home all time in AP top 10-ranked matchups. That was, until Saturday. The Hoosiers got their first-ever road win over a top-10 opponent.  Fernando Mendoza  had 246 total yards and threw a touchdown pass. The Hoosiers defense forced two humongous interceptions of Oregon QB  Dante Moore . The Ducks were one of three undefeated teams to lose so far in Week 7. Earlier in the day, Oklahoma and Missouri also lost. Here are the top plays and takeaways from the early slate.

title: Sources eye bevy of NFL trades before deadline
content: the three trades completed this week are expected to be a sign of things to come ahead of the league's Nov. 4 trade deadline . the league has had 88 trades over the past six years, an average of just under 15 per year .

title: Woods has another procedure on lower back
content: Tiger Woods went through seventh back surgery to replace a disk in his lower back . it was his second surgery of the year -- he had a procedure in march after rupturing his left Achilles tendon . woods said he consulted doctors and surgeons after experiencing pain and mobility issues .

title: Brewers or Dodgers? Blue Jays or Mariners? What MLB's final four must do to reach World Series
content: the 2025 league championship series is set for a trip to the world series on the line . the next day, the defending champion Los Angeles Dodgers and top-seeded Milwaukee Brewers will begin their series on a national league side of the bracket .

title: WWE Crown Jewel takeaways: Cena, Styles pass the torch to Rollins, Rhodes
content: the match between two retiring legends at the end of this year and Styles in 2026 featured an impressive amount of tributes to past opponents and WWE legends . only The Undertaker has more with 107, a record we will have to wait a while to see broken .
